meanings.definition: To make normal or bring back to a standard state.
meanings.sent1: She normalised her sleeping schedule by going to bed at the same time every night.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped him normalised his anxiety levels through relaxation techniques.
meanings.sent3: After the chaos of the party, she normalised the living room by putting everything back in its place.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful music normalised the tense atmosphere in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The routine of daily exercise normalised her energy levels and improved her overall health.

meanings.definition: To establish or maintain in a standard or usual condition.
meanings.sent1: The company normalised their production process to ensure consistent quality.
meanings.sent2: He normalised his study routine to achieve better grades in school.
meanings.sent3: The cat normalised its behavior after being trained to use the litter box.
meanings.sent4: The new regulations helped normalise safety procedures in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: Regular maintenance normalised the performance of the car, keeping it running smoothly.
